description:
In the friendly village of Sortville, there lived a kind wizard named Willy. Willy was known for his love of arranging things neatly. One day, while exploring the forest, he found a box filled with jumbled-up numbers written on colourful pebbles. Willy wanted to put them in order because he thought it would be fun. ---------- ### Task:
``` Now, it's your job to help Willy arrange these colourful pebbles in the correct order. Write a program named mergeSort to sort the numbers on the pebbles using this method. Expected Time Complexity is O(n*log(n)) ``` #### `Input:` ``` An integer n (1 to 100,000), tells you how many pebbles there are. A list of n numbers, written on the pebbles. Each number is between 1 and 100,000. ``` #### `Output:` ```A list of n numbers, the pebbles sorted from the smallest to the biggest.``` #### `Input:` ``` 4 10 5 3 7 ``` #### `Output:` ``` 3 5 7 10 ```
title: Merge Sort
